thread.title: Arsenal defender Shkodran Mustafi loses his unbeaten record as Gunners lose Watford
thread.title_full: Arsenal defender Shkodran Mustafi loses his unbeaten record as Gunners lose Watford

author: gboulton
title: Arsenal defender Shkodran Mustafi loses his unbeaten record as Gunners lose Watford
text:
22-1 record Arsenal defender Shkodran Mustafi loses his unbeaten record as Gunners lose Watford 
Arsene Wenger's side flopped at the Emirates as Younes Kaboul and Troy Deeney scored for the Hornets bY george Boulton Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments SHKODRAN MUSTAFI’S flawless 24-game unbeaten run in Arsenal’s team is over after Watford won at the Emirates. 5 Shkodran Mustafi’s unbeaten run with Arsenal was ended by Watford 
Alex Iwobi pulled one back for Arsene Wenger’s side in the second half but it was not enough to make it 23 consecutive unbeaten appearances for the Germany international. 
Keep up-to-date with all the latest transfer news and gossip ahead of the January window with SunSport’s daily LIVE blog 
Mustafi had gone 15 Premier League unbeaten – more than any other player in England’s top flight – before Watford’s arrival at the Emirates. 
The Gunners had only lost three matches all season before Tuesday’s defeat, after losing to Liverpool on the opening day of the season and back-to-back defeats against Everton and Manchester City in December. 
But Mustafi did not feature in any of these three defeats after suffering a hamstring injury after the 24-year-old made his debut in a 2-1 victory over Southampton in September. Getty Images Mustafi was unable to stop Troy Deeney who scored the winner for the Hornets Getty Images Shkodran Mustafi has been a revelation since arriving from Valencia Related stories VILLA LAND HOGAN Scott Hogan completes £14m move to Aston Villa after West Ham pull out of race for Brentford striker Bielik is a blue Arsenal youngster Krystian Bielik joins Birmingham on loan until the end of the season He's B-ake for good Chelsea reject £18million Bournemouth bid for Nathan Ake, reveals Eddie Howe Veen-dish move Scunthorpe reject sensational £4m Chinese Super League offer for striker Kevin van Veen Seize the Diay Hull bolster their ranks with signing of Villarreal midfielder Alfred N'Diaye on season-long loan Gab's the man Gabriel Obertan returns to England as he signs for Wigan Athletic until the end of the season TO BE RAVEL-ED... Former Manchester United wonderkid Ravel Morrison returns to QPR from Lazio on loan ALL SYSTEMS GUE Watford's Adlene Guedioura opts for Middlesbrough over Hull City after both clubs offer £3.5million 
Throughout the German’s successful time at Arsenal, since arriving from Valencia in the summer, he has netted one goal and picked up five yellow cards. 
Whilst team-mate Kieran Gibbs has 14 Premier League games unbeaten but his record extends into last season, having only played 205 league minutes this season. Getty Images Mustafi headed against Burnley to score his first and only Arsenal goal EPA Mustafi celebrate his goal with Alex Iwobi Arsenal defender Shkodran Mustafi trains hard to overcome hamstring injury
